modules.description: This module defines a type `t` representing colors in the context of gnuplot, including standard named colors and RGB values. It provides functions to convert these color values into the string format expected by gnuplot commands. Use this module when specifying line or fill colors in gnuplot visualizations, such as setting plot styles or annotations.

This module defines a type `t` representing axis labels for plots and provides a `create` function to construct label sets with optional `x` and `y` axis labels. It is used to configure labeled axes in plotting contexts, such as setting descriptive names for data visualization axes.

This module defines fill styles for plots, specifically supporting solid fills and predefined pattern fills. It works with the `t` variant type to represent different fill options. Use this module to specify how areas in a plot should be filled when rendering visualizations.

The module offers operations for creating line, point, step, and line-point plots, along with histograms and candlestick charts. It supports data series based on Y-only values, X-Y pairs, time-series, dates, mathematical functions, and OHLC financial data, enabling visualizations like time-series analysis, statistical distributions, and financial trend representation. Each operation allows customization via styling options such as color, line weight, and fill patterns.

This module defines data types for representing various types of ranges, including numeric, date, and time intervals. It provides constructors to create ranges for X, Y, or both axes, as well as date and time-based ranges with optional timezone handling. Use cases include setting axis limits in plots, filtering time-series data, and specifying date ranges for visualization.

This module defines an output type for configuring gnuplot rendering targets such as PNG, EPS, or interactive displays. It supports setting visual properties like font, image dimensions, and custom output parameters. Use it to direct plot output to files or display interfaces with specific formatting and size requirements.

This module executes plotting commands via a Gnuplot process, supporting single and multi-series data visualization, function plotting, and output configuration. It handles numeric, time, and date ranges, fill styles, axis labels, and color definitions to customize plots. Concrete use cases include generating time-series graphs, statistical charts, and financial visualizations with specific styling and output targets like PNG or interactive displays.
